channel.title: Status on Srikanth Perinkulam
channel.description: Recent content in Status on Srikanth Perinkulam

item.title: 13 Oct 2025 10:30
item.description: On my list of â€˜things to sortâ€™ is a bunch of files and physical documents that we’re compelled to move from place to place as we relocate every few years. I’ve been considering getting a document scanner to digest these files digitally and get rid of them. It’s been on my mind for a few years now and I think I’ve reached that decision threshold to bite the bullet and get a scanner. Now these devices run anywhere between 200 and 600 USD that I am NOT interested in spending for this indulgence. I’ll most likely hunt for one on ebay or backmarket sticking to my recycled hardware whenever feasible stand. The Fujitsu Fi 6130 seems to fit that ‘cheap and best’ bucket if sourced second hand. They seem to be selling for about 70 USD. ðŸ”—
item.content:encoded: On my list of â€˜things to sortâ€™ is a bunch of files and physical documents that we’re compelled to move from place to place as we relocate every few years. I’ve been considering getting a document scanner to digest these files digitally and get rid of them. It’s been on my mind for a few years now and I think I’ve reached that decision threshold to bite the bullet and get a scanner. Now these devices run anywhere between 200 and 600 USD that I am NOT interested in spending for this indulgence. I’ll most likely hunt for one on ebay or backmarket sticking to my recycled hardware whenever feasible stand. The Fujitsu Fi 6130 seems to fit that ‘cheap and best’ bucket if sourced second hand. They seem to be selling for about 70 USD. ðŸ”—

item.title: 01 Oct 2025 09:30
item.description:
For a day.

Switched off my phone from airplane mode first thing this morning to check on the ‘Shutdown’ status and as expected congress did fail to secure those 60 votes. Also received a couple emails mentioning my position was non-excepted and hence I was effectively furloughed.

Received another email around 2200 stating my position is now considered excepted and I need to report back to work the next working day. Alrighty, we’re back in business. ðŸ”—
item.content:encoded:
For a day.

Switched off my phone from airplane mode first thing this morning to check on the ‘Shutdown’ status and as expected congress did fail to secure those 60 votes. Also received a couple emails mentioning my position was non-excepted and hence I was effectively furloughed.

Received another email around 2200 stating my position is now considered excepted and I need to report back to work the next working day. Alrighty, we’re back in business. ðŸ”—

item.title: 12 Sep 2025 21:30
item.description: Added a uses page on my portal. Whoa. Adds up to almost 2500 USD. Agreed, that’s over several years but still! And, this doesn’t even include all of the gadgets I physically have! Wonder what a typical person spends on gadgets over a decade? How much do you spend? ðŸ”—
item.content:encoded: Added a uses page on my portal. Whoa. Adds up to almost 2500 USD. Agreed, that’s over several years but still! And, this doesn’t even include all of the gadgets I physically have! Wonder what a typical person spends on gadgets over a decade? How much do you spend? ðŸ”—

item.title: 21 Aug 2025 21:30
item.description: TIL Syncthing has an option to ‘ignore delete’ in its advanced settings. Suepr neat! This simplifies posting images from the phone and lets me ‘declutter’ the phone super fast. Likey, likey! ðŸ”—
item.content:encoded: TIL Syncthing has an option to ‘ignore delete’ in its advanced settings. Suepr neat! This simplifies posting images from the phone and lets me ‘declutter’ the phone super fast. Likey, likey! ðŸ”—

item.title: 16 Aug 2025 05:00
item.description: 25 years ago, I was much into collecting stamps. Somewhere along the road that kinda stagnated. Moved over that digitized collection to this portal here.
item.content:encoded: 25 years ago, I was much into collecting stamps. Somewhere along the road that kinda stagnated. Moved over that digitized collection to this portal here.

item.title: 03 Aug 2025 00:32
item.description:
Tweaked the maps page to reflect posts that have a set location. Currently this is a super vanilla layout and I think I should cluster these by region. I do like how it’s turned out though!

While at it, I realised I missed downloading pictures from my old Flickr account to Nextcloud. Brought those in and nuked the Flickr account. ðŸ”—
item.content:encoded:
Tweaked the maps page to reflect posts that have a set location. Currently this is a super vanilla layout and I think I should cluster these by region. I do like how it’s turned out though!

While at it, I realised I missed downloading pictures from my old Flickr account to Nextcloud. Brought those in and nuked the Flickr account. ðŸ”—

item.title: 19 Jul 2025 21:30
item.description:
We’d initially planned on visiting HongKong to celebrate Patti’s 80th and then head to India for a short trip for our R&R. Mummyjaan’s heart decided nah-ah and we ended up in Dubai. Once I knew she was stable and was receiving the care she needed, I decided to head to India. In a week, I covered 6 cities spending barely a night in each place. Visiting Pune was most fulfilling. Didn’t quite get to meet friends that I planned to meet in Hyderabad but got some local sightseeing checked off the list for family. Was great meeting family in Ahmedabad but I am NOT going back there in summer. So glad I made it to Trivandrum to meet Raju Mama. Drive to Ernakulam wasn’t quite planned but I guess that happened. Always fun visiting Ron in Bangalore but the flying Madras trip was one last minute surprise.

While I got to meet some friends and family, In hindsight, this trip was nuts. Way too much travel and strain. I think henceforth, I’m just going to stay a bit longer in one city and have whoever wants to meet come over. We’d initially cost-constructed this trip. Turned out to be one hell of a cost-construct! Just so happy to be back home! ðŸ”—
item.content:encoded:
We’d initially planned on visiting HongKong to celebrate Patti’s 80th and then head to India for a short trip for our R&R. Mummyjaan’s heart decided nah-ah and we ended up in Dubai. Once I knew she was stable and was receiving the care she needed, I decided to head to India. In a week, I covered 6 cities spending barely a night in each place. Visiting Pune was most fulfilling. Didn’t quite get to meet friends that I planned to meet in Hyderabad but got some local sightseeing checked off the list for family. Was great meeting family in Ahmedabad but I am NOT going back there in summer. So glad I made it to Trivandrum to meet Raju Mama. Drive to Ernakulam wasn’t quite planned but I guess that happened. Always fun visiting Ron in Bangalore but the flying Madras trip was one last minute surprise.

While I got to meet some friends and family, In hindsight, this trip was nuts. Way too much travel and strain. I think henceforth, I’m just going to stay a bit longer in one city and have whoever wants to meet come over. We’d initially cost-constructed this trip. Turned out to be one hell of a cost-construct! Just so happy to be back home! ðŸ”—
